content:
TITLE: Configuring Variable Expansion in Hadoop Configuration Files
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the new variable expansion feature added to Hadoop configuration files. It allows the use of ${variable} syntax to reference values from the configuration or Java system properties.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.7.2/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_37

LANGUAGE: XML
CODE:
```
${hadoop.tmp.dir}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Capacity Scheduler Queue Ordering Policies
DESCRIPTION: Configuration example for queue ordering policies in capacity-scheduler.xml. This snippet demonstrates how to set up FIFO (First In, First Out) application ordering for the default queue.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r3.4.1/hadoop-mapreduce-client/hadoop-mapreduce-client-jobclient/jdiff/xml/missingSinces.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
<property>
  <name>yarn.scheduler.capacity.root.ordering-policy</name>
  <value>priority-utilization</value>
  <description>The ordering policy inside the root queue</description>
</property>

<property>
  <name>yarn.scheduler.capacity.root.default.ordering-policy</name>
  <value>fifo</value>
  <description>The ordering policy inside the default queue.</description>
</property>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing Crypto Streams with Hadoop Stream Interfaces
DESCRIPTION: Implementation of crypto input and output streams that conform to Hadoop stream interfaces (HADOOP-10603). Contributed by Yi Liu and Charles Lamb.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.7.3/common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_1



----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Speculative Execution in Hadoop XML
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows configuration changes in hadoop-default.xml to allow finer-grained control over speculative execution for map and reduce tasks independently.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.7.3/common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_32

LANGUAGE: XML
CODE:
```
deprecated mapred.speculative.execution
add mapred.map.tasks.speculative.execution
add mapred.reduce.tasks.speculative.execution
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Alternate Hadoop Configuration Directory
DESCRIPTION: This change adds a --config option to Hadoop shell scripts, allowing users to specify an alternate configuration directory. This provides more flexibility in managing Hadoop configurations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.7.0/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
--config
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Find Command Implementation - Bash
DESCRIPTION: New filesystem find command implementation allowing advanced file searching capabilities.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.7.3/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
HADOOP-8989. hadoop fs -find feature
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Truncate API Addition - Java
DESCRIPTION: New truncate API exposed through FileSystem interface and shell command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.7.3/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: java
CODE:
```
HADOOP-11490. Expose truncate API via FileSystem and shell command.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Hadoop Streaming Field Separators
DESCRIPTION: Configuration settings for specifying field separators in Hadoop Streaming jobs for map and reduce operations. Default value is tab character.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.6.0/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: Properties
CODE:
```
stream.map.input.field.separator=\t
stream.map.output.field.separator=\t
stream.reduce.input.field.separator=\t
stream.reduce.output.field.separator=\t
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Hadoop Configuration XML Changes for Task Limits
DESCRIPTION: Configuration changes to hadoop-default.xml that modify the maximum number of map and reduce tasks per TaskTracker. Adds separate limits for map and reduce tasks, replacing the deprecated single task limit.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.7.2/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_27

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
mapred.tasktracker.map.tasks.maximum (default value of 2)
mapred.tasktracker.reduce.tasks.maximum (default value of 2)
mapred.tasktracker.tasks.maximum (deprecated for 0.16.0)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Hadoop Release Version in Bash
DESCRIPTION: Renames the branch-2.3 release version from 2.4.0-SNAPSHOT to 2.3.0-SNAPSHOT using a shell command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.7.0/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
# Implied bash command
sed -i 's/2.4.0-SNAPSHOT/2.3.0-SNAPSHOT/g' pom.xml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Configuration Parameters for Map-Reduce JVM and Environment Settings
DESCRIPTION: This snippet introduces new configuration parameters for setting JVM options, environment variables, and ulimit separately for map and reduce tasks. It also deprecates some older, combined parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.6.3/mapreduce/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Properties
CODE:
```
mapred.map.child.java.opts
mapred.reduce.child.java.opts
mapred.map.child.env
mapred.reduce.child.ulimit
mapred.map.child.env
mapred.reduce.child.ulimit
mapred.child.java.opts (deprecated)
mapred.child.env (deprecated)
mapred.child.ulimit (deprecated)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Hadoop SASL Properties in core-site.xml
DESCRIPTION: XML configuration snippet showing how to set the Hadoop SASL properties for QOP settings in the core-site.xml file, which affects security configuration across Hadoop components.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r3.4.1/hadoop-mapreduce-client/hadoop-mapreduce-client-common/jdiff/xml/missingSinces.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
<property>
  <name>hadoop.security.saslproperties.resolver.class</name>
  <value>org.apache.hadoop.security.SaslPropertiesResolver</value>
</property>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding getDouble() and setDouble() methods to Configuration class in Java
DESCRIPTION: This snippet adds support for getting and setting double values in the Hadoop Configuration class. It improves the flexibility of configuration handling in Hadoop.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.6.1/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
HADOOP-8415. Add getDouble() and setDouble() in 
org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration (Jan van der Lugt via harsh)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring MapReduce Job Resource Allocation in Java
DESCRIPTION: Configuration properties for controlling MapReduce job resource allocation, including memory and CPU settings for the Application Master and tasks.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.7.6/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-mapreduce/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
mapreduce.job.am.resource.mb
mapreduce.job.am.resource.cpu-vcores
yarn.app.am.resource.mb
yarn.app.am.resource.cpu-vcores
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding RPC Timeout Option in Java
DESCRIPTION: Introduces an option to set a timeout for Remote Procedure Calls (RPC) in Hadoop. This allows for better control over network operations and prevents indefinite waiting on unresponsive servers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.7.0/common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
// New RPC method with timeout option
rpc.callWithTimeout(timeout)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Hadoop Capacity Scheduler Properties in XML
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to define various capacity scheduler properties in the capacity-scheduler.xml file. This includes setting properties like queue capacities, user limits, and maximum application settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r3.4.1/hadoop-mapreduce-client/hadoop-mapreduce-client-jobclient/jdiff/xml/missingSinces.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
<property>
  <name>yarn.scheduler.capacity.maximum-applications</name>
  <value>10000</value>
  <description>Maximum number of applications that can be pending and running.</description>
</property>

<property>
  <name>yarn.scheduler.capacity.maximum-am-resource-percent</name>
  <value>0.1</value>
  <description>Maximum percent of resources in the cluster which can be used to run application masters i.e. controls number of concurrent running applications.</description>
</property>

<property>
  <name>yarn.scheduler.capacity.resource-calculator</name>
  <value>org.apache.hadoop.yarn.util.resource.DefaultResourceCalculator</value>
  <description>The ResourceCalculator implementation to be used to compare Resources in the scheduler.
  The default i.e. DefaultResourceCalculator only uses Memory while DominantResourceCalculator uses dominant-resource to compare multi-dimensional resources such as Memory, CPU etc.</description>
</property>

<property>
  <name>yarn.scheduler.capacity.root.queues</name>
  <value>default</value>
  <description>The queues at the this level (root is the root queue).</description>
</property>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Optimizing Edit Log Preservation in HDFS
DESCRIPTION: This optimization improves performance and addresses timeout issues by using hard-links to preserve old edit logs instead of copying them. It was implemented in version 2.6.1.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.7.2/hdfs/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
HDFS-8480. Fix performance and timeout issues in HDFS-7929 by using hard-links to preserve old edit logs, instead of copying them. (Zhe Zhang via Colin P. McCabe)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Fixing RPC client timeout in Hadoop (Java)
DESCRIPTION: Addresses HADOOP-11252 where the RPC client does not time out by default. This fix implements proper timeout behavior for RPC clients.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.6.4/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
HADOOP-11252. RPC client does not time out by default.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Field Separators for Streaming Jobs in Hadoop
DESCRIPTION: New configuration options allow specifying custom field separators for map and reduce input/output in Hadoop streaming jobs. These options default to tab ("\t") if not set.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.6.5/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: XML
CODE:
```
stream.map.input.field.separator
stream.map.output.field.separator
stream.reduce.input.field.separator
stream.reduce.output.field.separator
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: FileSystem Wildcard Syntax - File Pattern
DESCRIPTION: New wildcard input syntax support added in HADOOP-1968 for FileSystem operations using curly braces.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.7.5/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_21

LANGUAGE: plain
CODE:
```
{ }
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining YARN Configuration Constants in Java
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet defines multiple static final fields in the YarnConfiguration class. These fields represent default values for various YARN configuration parameters, covering aspects like ResourceManager settings, Router configurations, Timeline Service properties, and general YARN behaviors.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r3.4.0/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-api/jdiff/xml/missingSinces.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
public class YarnConfiguration {
  public static final int DEFAULT_RM_PLACEMENT_CONSTRAINTS_SCHEDULER_POOL_SIZE;
  public static final int DEFAULT_RM_PROXY_CONNECTION_TIMEOUT;
  public static final boolean DEFAULT_RM_PUBLISH_CONTAINER_EVENTS_ENABLED;
  public static final long DEFAULT_RM_RESERVATION_SYSTEM_MAX_PERIODICITY;
  public static final boolean DEFAULT_RM_RESOURCE_PROFILES_ENABLED;
  public static final String DEFAULT_RM_RESOURCE_PROFILES_SOURCE_FILE;
  // ... (many more fields)
  public static final boolean DEFAULT_YARN_WEBAPP_UI2_ENABLE;
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Wildcard Input Syntax in Hadoop FileSystem
DESCRIPTION: Adds support for wildcard input syntax using curly braces in Hadoop FileSystem operations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.6.1/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_20

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
FileSystem.globStatus(new Path("/user/{alice,bob}/*.txt"));
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Improving getSplits Performance in FileInputFormat
DESCRIPTION: Optimization to improve getSplits performance in FileInputFormat by using listLocatedStatus. This change is part of MAPREDUCE-1981.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.6.0/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-mapreduce/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
MAPREDUCE-1981. Improve getSplits performance by using listLocatedStatus
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Hadoop Script Environment Variables in Shell
DESCRIPTION: Allows HADOOP_PREFIX to be overridden in Hadoop scripts.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.7.3/common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
HADOOP-7801. HADOOP_PREFIX cannot be overriden. (Bruno Mah√© via tomwhite)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuration Changes for Hadoop Task Management
DESCRIPTION: Configuration changes to hadoop-default.xml that add mapred.tasktracker.map.tasks.maximum and mapred.tasktracker.reduce.tasks.maximum to replace the deprecated mapred.tasktracker.tasks.maximum parameter. This allows for better configuration of heterogeneous clusters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.7.1/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
add mapred.tasktracker.map.tasks.maximum (default value of 2)
add mapred.tasktracker.reduce.tasks.maximum (default value of 2)
remove mapred.tasktracker.tasks.maximum (deprecated for 0.16.0)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Making Shell Path with Optional Canonicalization
DESCRIPTION: Addition of a new parameter to FileUtil.makeShellPath API to control whether file paths should be canonicalized or not.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.6.0/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: java
CODE:
```
FileUtil.makeShellPath(path, canonicalize)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating WritableUtils.clone Method Signature in Java
DESCRIPTION: Changes the WritableUtils.clone method to accept a Configuration object instead of a JobConf object, improving flexibility.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.7.2/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_30

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
WritableUtils.clone(Configuration conf)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling Bash Tab Completion for Hadoop CLI
DESCRIPTION: A new contrib module provides bash tab completion for the Hadoop command-line interface. Installation instructions are provided in the README file of the contrib directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.6.5/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_19

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
bin/hadoop
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: IO Enhancement - NativeIO Support
DESCRIPTION: Added support for fadvise and sync_file_range in NativeIO with ReadaheadPool infrastructure for HDFS and MapReduce performance improvements.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.6.5/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: java
CODE:
```
ReadaheadPool
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding New SequenceFile.createWriter API in Java
DESCRIPTION: Introduces a new API for SequenceFile.createWriter that allows specifying blocksize, replication factor, and buffer size for the underlying HDFS file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.7.2/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_31

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
SequenceFile.createWriter(Configuration conf, Path file, int blockSize, short replication, int bufferSize)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Resource Manager Queue Properties in Hadoop
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the naming convention for configuring queue properties in Hadoop's resource manager. This allows for fine-grained control over scheduling parameters for different queues.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.7.1/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: Properties
CODE:
```
hadoop.rm.queue.queue-name.property-name
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding LZO Compressed Text File Splitter in Java
DESCRIPTION: This improvement adds an input format capable of splitting LZO compressed text files. It enables more efficient processing of LZO compressed data in Hadoop jobs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.7.0/common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
HADOOP-4640. Adds an input format that can split lzo compressed text files.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing DNSToSwitchMapping in Java
DESCRIPTION: Implements a base class for DNSToSwitchMapping that can offer extra topology information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.7.3/common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
HADOOP-7777 Implement a base class for DNSToSwitchMapping implementations 
that can offer extra topology information. (stevel)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding FileSystem API for Closing All File Systems for a UGI in Java
DESCRIPTION: Adds a new FileSystem API closeAllForUGI() for closing all file systems associated with a particular UserGroupInformation (UGI). This allows for better resource management when dealing with multiple file systems.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.7.0/common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
FileSystem.closeAllForUGI(UserGroupInformation ugi)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Handling Insufficient Space for Map Output Fetching
DESCRIPTION: Bug fix to prevent the reducer from implicating map attempts when there is insufficient space to fetch map output. This addresses MAPREDUCE-5251.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.6.0/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-mapreduce/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
MAPREDUCE-5251. Reducer should not implicate map attempt if it has insufficient space to fetch map output
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Modifying BlockUnderConstructionFeature.truncateBlock type (Java)
DESCRIPTION: Improvement to change the type of BlockUnderConstructionFeature.truncateBlock to BlockInfo for better type consistency.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.7.7/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-hdfs/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
HDFS-12884. BlockUnderConstructionFeature.truncateBlock should be of type BlockInfo.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding copyBytes Method to Text and BytesWritable Classes in Java
DESCRIPTION: Introduces a new copyBytes method to both Text and BytesWritable classes, providing a way to efficiently copy byte data between these Writable types.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.6.4/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
public void copyBytes(byte[] bytes, int start, int len)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring MapReduce Task Logging Levels in Java
DESCRIPTION: New configuration options for setting logging levels separately for map and reduce tasks.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.6.3/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-mapreduce/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
Configuration changes:
  add mapred.map.child.log.level 
  add mapred.reduce.child.log.level
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Job Status Persistence in Hadoop XML
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows configuration changes to hadoop-default.xml for persisting job statuses in HDFS. It adds new properties to control persistence activation, duration, and storage location.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.7.3/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_24

LANGUAGE: XML
CODE:
```
add mapred.job.tracker.persist.jobstatus.active (default value of false)
add mapred.job.tracker.persist.jobstatus.hours (default value of 0)
add mapred.job.tracker.persist.jobstatus.dir (default value of
                                                /jobtracker/jobsInfo)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuration Changes for Job Status Persistence in Hadoop MapReduce
DESCRIPTION: Configuration properties added to hadoop-default.xml for persisting completed job statuses in HDFS. These settings control whether persistence is active, how long job information is retained, and where job information is stored.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.7.0/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
add mapred.job.tracker.persist.jobstatus.active (default value of false)
add mapred.job.tracker.persist.jobstatus.hours (default value of 0)
add mapred.job.tracker.persist.jobstatus.dir (default value of
                                              /jobtracker/jobsInfo)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing High-Performance Secure Random Number Sources in Java
DESCRIPTION: This code implements high-performance secure random number sources in Java, likely for use in cryptographic operations within Hadoop.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.6.3/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
HADOOP-10734. Implement high-performance secure random number sources. (Yi Liu via Colin Patrick McCabe)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Triggering Full Block Reports in HDFS DataNode
DESCRIPTION: Adds a command to allow system administrators to manually trigger full block reports from a DataNode. This improves diagnostic and maintenance capabilities.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.7.6/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-hdfs/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
HDFS-7278. Add a command that allows sysadmins to manually trigger full block reports from a DN (cmccabe)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Hadoop Common with hadoop-policy.xml
DESCRIPTION: Example of the hadoop-policy.xml configuration file that defines ACL settings for Hadoop services. This file controls which users or groups have access to specific Hadoop services through Access Control Lists.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r3.3.4/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/jdiff/xml/missingSinces.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
<property>
  <name>security.client.protocol.acl</name>
  <value>administrator group</value>
  <description>ACL for ClientProtocol, which is used by user code
  via the DistributedFileSystem.
  The ACL is a comma-separated list of user and group names. The user and
  group list is separated by a blank. For e.g. "alice,bob users,wheel".
  A special value of "*" means all users are allowed.</description>
</property>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring YARN Application Classpath in Java
DESCRIPTION: Sets a default value for the YARN_APPLICATION_CLASSPATH configuration property in YarnConfiguration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.6.0/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-mapreduce/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
MAPREDUCE-4422. YARN_APPLICATION_CLASSPATH needs a documented default value in YarnConfiguration.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: File System Wildcard Support
DESCRIPTION: Implementation of globStatus method in FileSystem interface to support wildcard patterns, replacing older globPath and listPath methods.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.7.0/common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_23

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
FileSystem.globStatus
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing ONCRPC and XDR Protocols (Java)
DESCRIPTION: Implements the ONCRPC (Open Network Computing Remote Procedure Call) and XDR (External Data Representation) protocols in Hadoop. This adds support for these standard protocols, enhancing Hadoop's interoperability.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.6.3/common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
ONCRPC
XDR
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Multiple Job Initialization Threads in Java
DESCRIPTION: Introduced a configuration parameter to control the number of job initialization threads. This allows for parallel job initialization, potentially improving cluster startup times.

TITLE: Configuring IPC client connection retries in Hadoop core-default.xml
DESCRIPTION: Adds a new configuration property 'ipc.client.connect.max.retries.on.timeouts' to the core-default.xml file to control the number of retries for IPC client connections on socket timeouts.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.7.6/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: XML
CODE:
```
<property>
  <name>ipc.client.connect.max.retries.on.timeouts</name>
  <value>45</value>
  <description>Indicates the number of retries a client will make to establish
               a server connection when the socket times out.</description>
</property>
```

```
    </property>
```

TITLE: Limiting QuickSort Recursion Depth (Java)
DESCRIPTION: Limits the recursion depth for QuickSort to prevent StackOverflowErrors. Switches to HeapSort when partitioning depth exceeds a multiple of log(n) to avoid O(n*n) cases.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.7.3/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_20

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
HADOOP-3442. Limit recursion depth on the stack for QuickSort to prevent
StackOverflowErrors. To avoid O(n*n) cases, when partitioning depth exceeds
a multiple of log(n), change to HeapSort. (cdouglas)
```

TITLE: Configuring Hadoop Common Data Format Options
DESCRIPTION: Example of Hadoop Common configuration property for controlling data format options. This snippet shows the configuration for compression codecs, which specifies implementations for different compression formats.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r3.3.4/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/jdiff/xml/missingSinces.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
<property>
  <name>io.compression.codecs</name>
  <value>org.apache.hadoop.io.compress.DefaultCodec,org.apache.hadoop.io.compress.GzipCodec,
      org.apache.hadoop.io.compress.BZip2Codec,org.apache.hadoop.io.compress.DeflateCodec,
      org.apache.hadoop.io.compress.SnappyCodec,org.apache.hadoop.io.compress.Lz4Codec
  </value>
  <description>A list of the compression codec classes that can be used 
               for compression/decompression. In addition to any classes specified
               with this property (which take precedence), codec classes on the
               classpath are discovered using a Java ServiceLoader.</description>
</property>
```

TITLE: Using WritableComparator in Hadoop

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
public class MyKeyComparator extends WritableComparator {
  protected MyKeyComparator() {
    super(MyKey.class, true);
  }
  
  @Override
  public int compare(WritableComparable a, WritableComparable b) {
    // Custom comparison logic
  }
}
```

TITLE: Configuring Capacity Scheduler Default Queue Settings
DESCRIPTION: Example configuration for the default queue properties in capacity-scheduler.xml. This includes capacity, maximum capacity, user-limit-factor, and state settings for the default queue.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r3.4.1/hadoop-mapreduce-client/hadoop-mapreduce-client-jobclient/jdiff/xml/missingSinces.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
<property>
  <name>yarn.scheduler.capacity.root.default.capacity</name>
  <value>100</value>
  <description>Default queue target capacity.</description>
</property>

<property>
  <name>yarn.scheduler.capacity.root.default.user-limit-factor</name>
  <value>1</value>
  <description>Default queue user limit a percentage from 0.0 to 1.0.</description>
</property>

<property>
  <name>yarn.scheduler.capacity.root.default.maximum-capacity</name>
  <value>100</value>
  <description>The maximum capacity of the default queue.</description>
</property>

<property>
  <name>yarn.scheduler.capacity.root.default.state</name>
  <value>RUNNING</value>
  <description>The state of the default queue. State can be one of RUNNING or STOPPED.</description>
</property>

<property>
  <name>yarn.scheduler.capacity.root.default.acl_submit_applications</name>
  <value>*</value>
  <description>The ACL of who can submit jobs to the default queue.</description>
</property>

<property>
  <name>yarn.scheduler.capacity.root.default.acl_administer_queue</name>
  <value>*</value>
  <description>The ACL of who can administer jobs on the default queue.</description>
</property>
```

SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.5.2/mapreduce/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: XML
CODE:
```
<target name="tools" depends="compile">
  <jar jarfile="${build.dir}/${name}-tools-${version}.jar">
    <fileset dir="${build.classes}">
      <include name="org/apache/hadoop/tools/**/*.class"/>
    </fileset>
  </jar>
</target>
```

TITLE: Checking container-executor for vulnerability using readelf command in Linux
DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to determine if a Hadoop container-executor binary is vulnerable to CVE-2023-26031 by examining its RUNPATH or RPATH settings. A vulnerable binary will have '../lib/native/' in its runpath, while a safe one will only have '$ORIGIN/'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/src/cve_list.md#2025-04-08_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ readelf -d container-executor|grep 'RUNPATH\|RPATH'
0x000000000000001d (RUNPATH)            Library runpath: [$ORIGIN/:../lib/native/]
```

TITLE: Adding Pipes Facility for C++ MapReduce in Hadoop
DESCRIPTION: Introduces the pipes facility to allow writing MapReduce programs in C++.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.7.5/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_27

LANGUAGE: C++
CODE:
```
// Example C++ MapReduce program using Hadoop Pipes
#include "hadoop/Pipes.hh"
#include "hadoop/TemplateFactory.hh"
#include "hadoop/StringUtils.hh"

class WordCountMap: public HadoopPipes::Mapper {
public:
  void map(HadoopPipes::MapContext& context) {
    // Map implementation
  }
};

class WordCountReduce: public HadoopPipes::Reducer {
public:
  void reduce(HadoopPipes::ReduceContext& context) {
    // Reduce implementation
  }
};

int main(int argc, char *argv[]) {
  return HadoopPipes::runTask(HadoopPipes::TemplateFactory<WordCountMap, 
                              WordCountReduce>());
}
```

TITLE: Configuring Apache Hadoop Website YAML
DESCRIPTION: This YAML configuration defines the structure and settings for the Apache Hadoop project website. It includes site metadata, menu items, and build parameters for generating the site.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r3.1.2/hadoop-mapreduce-client/hadoop-mapreduce-client-common/jdiff/xml/missingSinces.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
# you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
# You may obtain a copy of the License at
#
#   http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
#
# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
# distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
# WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
# See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
# limitations under the License. See accompanying LICENSE file.

project_name: Apache Hadoop
project_description: Framework for distributed processing of large data sets across clusters of computers using simple programming models
project_snapshot: true
decoration: /WEB/hadoop.apache.org/
standard_notices: /WEB/hadoop.apache.org/notices/
base: /hadoop
release_version: 3.3.6
release_date: 25 July, 2023
release_hash: 265ab66a93a0f78b94e3a79ee4bd70a21ecda150
doap_file: project.rdf
decorator_target: &decorator_target hadoop
menus:
  - hadoop
populate_versions:
  - module: hadoop
    from: 3.3.0
    to: 3.3.6
    releases:
      - 3.3.6
      - 3.3.5
      - 3.3.4
      - 3.3.3
      - 3.3.2
      - 3.3.1
      - 3.3.0
    branches:
      - branch-3.3
    latest:
      3.3.6:
        release: true
versions:
  - module: hadoop
    version: 3.3.6
    default: true
  - module: hadoop
    version: trunk
    unstable: true

build:
  plugins:
    - asciidoc
    - scalate
    - assets
    - versions2
  assets:
    - css
    - images
  directives:
    - "docs/current:docs/3.3.6"
  versions:
    - module: hadoop
      start: 3.3.0
      end: 3.3.6
production_url: https://hadoop.apache.org
url: https://hadoop.apache.org
base_url: /hadoop
destination: content
show_drafts: false
future: true
lsi: false
highligher: rouge
markdown: kramdown
strict_front_matter: true
kramdown:
  input: GFM
  syntax_highlighter: rouge
  syntax_highlighter_opts:
    block:
      line_numbers: true
      start_line: 1
plugins:
  - jekyll-asciidoc
  - jekyll-redirect-from

asciidoc: {}
asciidoctor:
  base_dir: :docdir
  safe: unsafe
  attributes:
    imagesdir: /images
    icons: font
    source-highlighter: rouge
    rouge-css: style
```

TITLE: Fixing NullPointerException in MapReduce Deprecated Key Handling (Java)
DESCRIPTION: Addresses a NullPointerException that occurs when handling deprecated configuration keys in MapReduce. This fix improves the robustness of the configuration system.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.7.7/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-mapreduce/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
public class Configuration {
  public String get(String name) {
    String[] names = handleDeprecation(deprecatedKeyMap.get(name));
    String result = null;
    for(String n : names) {
      result = getProperty(n);
      if(result != null) {
        break;
      }
    }
    return result;
  }
}
```

TITLE: Defining HTML Structure for Apache Hadoop Website
DESCRIPTION: This HTML snippet defines the structure of the Apache Hadoop project website. It includes the DOCTYPE declaration, head section with meta tags and title, and the beginning of the body content with navigation menus.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.10.2/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-hdfs/jdiff/xml/missingSinces.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_0

```
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
<head>
  <meta charset="UTF-8" />
  <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0" />
  <title>Apache Hadoop</title>
</head>

<body>
<div id="container">
  <div id="header">
    <div id="headerButtons">
      <a href="http://www.apache.org/">Apache Software Foundation</a> |
      <a href="http://www.apache.org/foundation/sponsorship.html">Sponsorship</a> |
      <a href="http://www.apache.org/foundation/thanks.html">Thanks</a>
    </div>
    <div id="headerLogo">
      <a href="/">
        <img alt="Apache Hadoop" src="/images/hadoop-logo.jpg" />
      </a>
    </div>
  </div>

  <div id="navigation">
    <ul>
      <li><a href="/">Home</a></li>
      <li><a href="/releases.html">Releases</a></li>
      <li><a href="/documentation.html">Documentation</a></li>
      <li><a href="/community.html">Community</a></li>
      <li><a href="/support.html">Support</a></li>
      <li><a href="/trademarks.html">Trademarks</a></li>
    </ul>
  </div>

  <div id="content">
```

TITLE: Removing Main-Class from build.xml in MapReduce Tools (XML)
DESCRIPTION: Removes the incorrectly set Main-Class attribute from the build.xml file for MapReduce tools. Also renames the 'tools-jar' target to 'tools' for clarity.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.7.7/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-mapreduce/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: XML
CODE:
```
<project name="hadoop-mapreduce-tools" default="jar">
  <target name="tools" depends="compile">
    <jar jarfile="${build.dir}/${name}-${version}.jar">
      <fileset dir="${build.classes}">
        <include name="**/*.class"/>
      </fileset>
    </jar>
  </target>
</project>
```

TITLE: Configuring Socket Factories in Hadoop
DESCRIPTION: Allows specialization and configuration of socket factories in Hadoop, introducing StandardSocketFactory and SocksSocketFactory for SOCKS proxy support.

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
Configuration conf = new Configuration();
conf.setClass("hadoop.rpc.socket.factory.class.default", StandardSocketFactory.class, SocketFactory.class);
// Or for SOCKS proxy
conf.setClass("hadoop.rpc.socket.factory.class.default", SocksSocketFactory.class, SocketFactory.class);
```

TITLE: Checking safe container-executor permissions configuration with ls command
DESCRIPTION: This code shows a safe configuration of container-executor without the SUID bit set. Though this configuration doesn't support Yarn Secure Containers, it prevents the privilege escalation vulnerability by showing standard executable permissions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/src/cve_list.md#2025-04-08_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ ls -laF /opt/hadoop/bin/container-executor
-rwxr-xr-x. 1 yarn hadoop 802968 May 9 20:21 /opt/hadoop/bin/container-executor
```

TITLE: Defining HTML Structure for Apache Hadoop Website
DESCRIPTION: This HTML snippet defines the basic structure of the Apache Hadoop project website. It includes meta tags for character encoding and viewport, links to external stylesheets, and sets up the main layout with a header, navigation, and content area.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r3.1.1/hadoop-mapreduce-client/hadoop-mapreduce-client-common/jdiff/xml/missingSinces.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: HTML
CODE:
```
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">

<head>
    <meta charset="utf-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Apache Hadoop</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/bootstrap@5.2.3/dist/css/bootstrap.min.css"
        integrity="sha384-rbsA2VBKQhggwzxH7pPCaAqO46MgnOM80zW1RWuH61DGLwZJEdK2Kadq2F9CUG65" crossorigin="anonymous">
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="/css/site.css">
</head>

<body>
    <header>
        <nav>
            <div class="logo-container">
                <a href="/">
                    <img width="210" height="51" class="logo" src="/hadoop-logo.jpg" alt="Apache Hadoop logo">
                </a>
            </div>
        </nav>
    </header>
    <main class="content-container">
        <div class="container">
            ${content}
        </div>
    </main>
</body>

</html>
```

TITLE: Accessing MapReduce Counters in Java Driver Code
DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to access and read counter values from a completed MapReduce job in the driver program. It demonstrates retrieving counter groups, counters, and their values after job completion.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r3.0.0/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-hdfs/jdiff/xml/missingSinces.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: java
CODE:
```
Counters counters = job.getCounters();
for(CounterGroup group : counters) {
  System.out.println("* Counter Group: " + group.getDisplayName() + " (" + group.getName() + ")");
  System.out.println("  number of counters in this group: " + group.size());
  for(Counter counter : group) {
    System.out.println("  - " + counter.getDisplayName() + ": " + counter.getName() + ": " + counter.getValue());
  }
}
```

TITLE: Using WritableComparator for Custom Key Types in Java
DESCRIPTION: WritableComparator is modified to only create instances of the keytype if the type does not define a WritableComparator. This change is part of HADOOP-3665.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.5.2/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
public class CustomKeyComparator extends WritableComparator {
  protected CustomKeyComparator() {
    super(CustomKey.class, true);
  }

  @Override
  public int compare(WritableComparable a, WritableComparable b) {
    CustomKey ka = (CustomKey)a;
    CustomKey kb = (CustomKey)b;
    // Implement comparison logic
  }
}
```

TITLE: Adding New MapReduce API in Java
DESCRIPTION: This snippet introduces the new MapReduce API in org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce package, deprecating the old API in org.apache.hadoop.mapred. It highlights key differences including the use of Context objects, changes to Mapper and Reducer, and modifications to output file naming conventions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r0.23.11/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
// New API package
org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce

// Old API package (deprecated)
org.apache.hadoop.mapred

// Example of new Mapper with run method
public class NewMapper extends Mapper<K1, V1, K2, V2> {
  public void run(Context context) throws IOException, InterruptedException {
    // Control loop for the task
  }
}

// New output file naming convention
part-r-00000 // for reduce 0 output
part-m-00000 // for map 0 output
```

TITLE: Configuring MapReduce Slow-Start for Reduce Tasks in Java
DESCRIPTION: This configuration change adds a new parameter 'mapred.reduce.slowstart.completed.maps' to mapred-default.xml. ```

```
title: Release 2.7.3 available
date: 2016-08-26
linked: true
---

Please see the [Hadoop 2.7.3 Release
Notes](https://hadoop.apache.org/docs/r2.7.3/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/releasenotes.html)
for the list of 221 bug fixes and patches since the previous release
2.7.2.
```

TITLE: Structuring HTML Template for Apache Hadoop Website
DESCRIPTION: This HTML template sets up the basic structure for the Apache Hadoop project website. It includes meta tags for character encoding and viewport, links to stylesheets, and script references. The body contains placeholder divs for header, menu, and main content areas.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r3.3.2/hadoop-mapreduce-client/hadoop-mapreduce-client-jobclient/jdiff/xml/missingSinces.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_0

```
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8" />
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0" />
    <title>Apache Hadoop</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="/css/styles.css" type="text/css" />
    <link rel="shortcut icon" href="/images/favicon.ico" />
</head>
<body>
<div id="header">
</div>
<div id="menu">
</div>
<div id="content">
</div>
<script type="text/javascript" src="/js/apache-hadoop.js"></script>
</body>
</html>
```

SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r2.9.2/hadoop-mapreduce-client/hadoop-mapreduce-client-common/jdiff/xml/missingSinces.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
mvn clean site site:stage -DskipTests
```

TITLE: Configuring Job Status Persistence
DESCRIPTION: Configuration settings in hadoop-default.xml for persisting job statuses in HDFS, allowing JobClient to query information about decommissioned jobs across JobTracker restarts.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/content/docs/r0.23.11/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/CHANGES.txt#2025-04-08_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
mapred.job.tracker.persist.jobstatus.active (default value of false)
mapred.job.tracker.persist.jobstatus.hours (default value of 0)
mapred.job.tracker.persist.jobstatus.dir (default value of /jobtracker/jobsInfo)
```

TITLE: Checking non-vulnerable container-executor configuration using readelf in Linux
DESCRIPTION: This code shows the expected output when examining a non-vulnerable container-executor binary where the RUNPATH doesn't include the '../lib/native/' relative path that enables the privilege escalation vulnerability.
SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/hadoop-site/blob/asf-site/src/cve_list.md#2025-04-08_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ readelf -d container-executor|grep 'RUNPATH\|RPATH'
0x000000000000001d (RUNPATH)            Library runpath: [$ORIGIN/]
```
